'''The Garden Awakens''' is a [[game drop]] released on December 3, 2024, as [[Java Edition 1.21.4]] and [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.50]]. It focuses on the [[pale garden]], a biome that is home to a mob called the [[creaking]], and other related blocks. It was announced at [[Minecraft Live 2024]].

In an official and publicly shared survey about Minecraft Live<ref>{{cite|url=https://survey.alchemer.com/s3/8003210/Minecraft-Live-Survey-2024|title=Minecraft Live Survey 2024}}</ref><ref>{{Tweet|Minecraft|1840816372349353985|Got thoughts on #MinecraftLIVE? We want to know! Take the survey now and let us know what you think: https://aka.ms/MCL24Survey|September 30, 2024}}</ref> and in file names on [[Minecraft.net]],<ref>{{mcnet|test-eyeblossom-and-resin|Test eyeblossom and resin|October 23, 2024|Sophie Austin}}</ref><ref>https://www.minecraft.net/content/dam/minecraftnet/games/minecraft/screenshots/mcv_holiday_eyeblossom-resin_testing_header_1280x768.jpg</ref> the drop was referred to as the '''Vanilla Holiday Update'''. During development, it was referred to as the '''Winter Drop''', the name of the corresponding [[experiment]] {{in|JE}}. The final name and release date of the update were revealed on November 27, 2024.<ref>{{mcnet|the-garden-awakens-drop-date|The Garden Awakens drop date|November 27, 2024|Sophie Austin}}</ref>

Experimental features for the drop would be released prior to the finalized release as part of [[Java Edition 1.21.2]].

[[File:Garden awakens drop name reveal announcement banner.jpg|thumb|The image used as the name reveal banner of The Garden Awakens]]

== Additions ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Creaking_Heart.png|32px]] [[Creaking heart]]'''
* A "living block" found in [[pale oak tree]]s, covered on all sides by pale oak logs.
*[[File:Active_Creaking_Heart_JE1_BE1.png|32px]] Only activates when placed between two pale oak logs in the same orientation and can't be deactivated unless the block is broken.
** Produces eerie sounds.
** Spawns [[creaking]]s at night when activated and links itself to them.
*** Produces [[resin clump]] when the creaking gets hit.
* Drops resin clump and [[experience]] when broken without [[Silk Touch]].
* Can also be crafted using two [[pale oak log]]s and a [[block of resin]].

'''{{Animate|Closed Eyeblossom JE1.png; Open Eyeblossom JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Eyeblossom]]'''
* A new [[flower]] found in the [[pale garden]] biome.
* They exist in two variants: closed and open.
** Eyeblossoms transition between the two variants based on the time of day.
*** During the night, eyeblossoms become open.
*** During the day, they become closed.
** In dimensions that do not have a day/night cycle, they remain as-is.
* Eyeblossoms planted on the ground communicate with each other, helping each other to open or close.
* Can be use to make [[suspicious stew]] which faves it [[Blindness]] or [[Nausea]] depending on the variant.
* Can be crafted into [[orange dye|orange]] or [[gray dye]] depending on the variant.
* Produces eerie sounds when on top of [[pale moss block]].

'''[[File:Pale Hanging Moss.png|32px]] [[Pale hanging moss]]'''
* A vine-like block generate beneath the [[pale oak leaves]] and [[logs]].
** Produces creaking sounds when place to its corresponding block.
* Does not grow naturally.
* Cannot be climbed.

'''[[File:Pale Moss Block.png|32px]] [[Pale moss block]]'''
* A pale variant of the regular [[moss block]].
* Generates in large patches under the pale oak trees.
* Unlike regular moss block, it can be burned.

'''[[File:Pale Moss Carpet.png|32px]] [[Pale moss carpet]]'''
* A pale variant of the regular [[moss carpet]].
* Unlike regular moss carpet, it can be burned.
* When placed, pale moss carpet grows up to two blocks on the solid faces of any block that borders it. {{Animate|Pale Moss Carpet (low).png;Pale Moss Carpet (tall).png|32px}}
** Pale moss carpet can be bonemealed to grow to full on all solid faces of any block that borders it.

=== Items ===
'''{{InvSprite|Creaking Spawn Egg Revision 1}} [[Creaking spawn egg]]'''
* Used to spawn a [[creaking]].

'''{{InvSprite|Resin Brick}} [[Resin brick]]'''
* Used to craft [[resin bricks]].
* Can also be used to trim armor.

=== Mobs ===
'''[[File:Creaking JE1.png|32px]] [[Creaking]]'''
* A [[hostile]] [[mob]] that spawned by active [[creaking hearts]] during the night or thunderstorms.
* Only moves when a player is looking away from it.
* Naturally indestructible. 
** Can only be killed by destroying its respective creaking heart. Can be damaged if spawned via the spawn egg or the {{cmd|summon}} command.
* Emits particles that lead to its creaking heart when hit.

=== Non-mob entities ===
'''[[File:Pale Oak Boat.png|32px]] [[Pale oak boat]]'''
* Including [[File:Pale Oak Boat with Chest.png|32px]] [[Pale Oak Boat with Chest|a chest variant]].

=== Biome ===
'''{{BiomeLink|Pale garden}}'''
* Generates with [[pale oak]] trees, [[pale moss block]]s, [[pale moss carpet]]s, [[pale hanging moss]], and [[eyeblossom]]s.

=== Generated features ===
'''[[File:Pale Oak Tree.png|32px]] [[Pale oak]]'''
* A tree that generates on cherry grove.

'''[[File:Pale_moss_patch.png|32px]] [[Pale moss patch]]'''
* Pile of mosses that generate beneath the pale oak tree.

== Changes ==
'''{{Animate|Evoker JE3.png;Illusioner JE3.png;Pillager BE1.png;Vindicator JE4.png|32px}} [[Illagers]]'''
* Are now scared of the creaking.

== Further revisions ==
=== ''Bedrock Edition'' ===
* [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.51|1.21.51]] was released to fix critical bugs related to 1.21.50.
* [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.60|1.21.60]] was a minor update which changed some features from The Garden Awakens and adds experimental features from [[Spring to Life]].
* [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.61|1.21.61]] was released to fix critical bugs related to 1.21.60.
* [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.62|1.21.62]] was released to fix critical bugs related to 1.21.61.

== Promotions ==
[[File:Beyond the Pale Garden key art.jpg|thumb|Key art for the event.]]
{{Main|Expect the unexpected}}
To promote the release of the drop, an advertising campaign ran from December 4 to December 11, featuring many products with ties to the pale garden, such as add-ons and community incentives.
